text.section: In this section, "quota" means the mandating of a finite number of arrests made or citations issued that a law enforcement officer must meet in a specified time period.

A law enforcement agency may not:
establish a formal or informal quota for the law enforcement agency or law enforcement officers of the agency; or
use the number of arrests made or citations issued by a law enforcement officer as the sole or primary criterion for promotion, demotion, dismissal, or transfer of the officer.

This section does not preclude a law enforcement agency from:
using quantitative data for arrests, citations, and other law enforcement activities as management tools or in evaluating performance;
collecting, analyzing, and applying information concerning the number of arrests and citations in order to ensure that a particular law enforcement officer or group of law enforcement officers does not violate an applicable legal obligation; or
assessing the proportion of the arrests made and citations issued by a law enforcement officer or group of law enforcement officers.
